gurmukhi: pY ijh ky hm kwrn ko pg kMtkkw isr DUp shwry ]so hm kO qum dyhu bqwie prYN qum pwien jwv iqhwry ]482]
transliteration: Pai Jih Ke Ham Kaaran Ko Pag Kantak-kaa Sir Dhoop Sahdare|| So Ham Kau Toum Deh(u) Bataae Darain Roum Paain Jaav Tihdare||482||
translation: “We are wandering enduring the sunshine over our heads and the pain of thorns in our feet for his sake, tell us where is that Krishna; we fall at your feet.”482.

gurmukhi: byl ibrwjq hY ijh jwgul cMpk kw su pRBw Aiq pweI ]mOilisrI gul lwl gulwb Drw iqn PUln so Cb CweI ]
transliteration: Bel Biraajat Hai Jih Jaagul Channdak Kaa Su Prabhaa At(i) Paaee|| Maul(i)sirigul Laal Gulaab Dharaa Tin Phoolan So Chhab Chhaade||
translation: Searching for Krishna, those gopis are wandering there where there are trees of Bel, bushes of Champa, and plants of Maulshri and red rose;

gurmukhi: cMpk maulisrI bt qwl lvMg lqw kcnwr suhweI ]bwr JrY Jrnw igr qy kib sXwm khY Aiq hI suKdweI ]483]
transliteration: Chhanpak Maulsiribat Taal Lavan Lataa Kachnaar Suhaaee|| Baar Jdarai Jharnaa Gir Te Kabi Syaam Kahai At(i) Hisoukhdaaee||483||
translation: The trees of Champak, Maulshri, Lavanglata, Kachnar etc. look impressive and extremely peace-giving cataracts are flowing.483.

gurmukhi: iqn kwnn ko hir ky ihq qy gupIAw biRj kI ieh BwNq khY ]br pIpr hyir ihXw n khUM ieh ky ihq so isr DUp shY ]
transliteration: Tin Kaanan Ko Har(i) Ke Hit Te Goupiaa Brij Kieh Bhaant Kahai|| Bar Peepar Her(i) Hiyaa Na Kahoon Eh Ke Hit So Sir Dhoop Sahai||
translation: Bound in the bond of love for Krishna, the gopis are saying, “Is he not there near the Peepal tree?” And saying this and enduring the sunshine over their heads, they are running hither and thither;

gurmukhi: Aho ikau qij Awvq ho Brqw ibn kwnH ipKy nih Dwm rhY ]iek bwq krY sun kY iek bol brUKn ko hir jwn ghY ]484]
transliteration: Aho Kio Taj(i) Aavat Ho Bhartaa Bin Kaahn Pikhe Nah(i) Dhaam Rahai|| Ik Baat Darai Soun Kai Ik Bol Badookhan Ko Har(i) Jaan Gadai||484||
translation: Then they hold consultations among themselves why they have left their husbands and are oscillating here and there, but alongwith it they receive this reply from their mind that they are running because they cannot live without Krishna; in this way someon

gurmukhi: kwnH ibXog ko mwn bDU biRj folq hY bn bIc idvwnI ]kUMjn kXoN kurlwq iPrY iqh jw ijh jw kCu Kwn n pwnI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Biyog Ko Maan Badhoo Brij Dolat Hai Ban Beech Divaanee|| Koonjan Jyon Kurlaat Phirai Tih Jaa Jih Jaa Kachhu Khaan Naa Paanee||
translation: The women of Braja have become mad in his separation and are wandering in the forest like the crying and wandering crane; they are not conscious of eating and drinking;

gurmukhi: eyk igrY murJwie Drw pr eyk auTy kih kY ieh bwnI ]nyh bFwie mhw hm so kq jwq BXo Bgvwn gumwnI ]485]
transliteration: Ek Girai Murjhaae Dharaa Par Ek Outhe Kah(i) Kai Eh Baanee|| Neh Badhaae Mahaa Ham So Kat Jaat Bhayo Bhagvaan Goumaanee||485||
translation: Someone droops and falls down on the ground and someone gets up saying where that proud Krishna, increasing his love with us, has gone?485.

gurmukhi: nYn ncwie mno miRg sy sB gopin ko mn cor lXo hY ]qwhI kY bIc rhXo gif kY iqh qy nih CUtn nYk BXo hY ]
transliteration: Nain Nachaae Mano Mrig Se Sabh Gopan(i) Ko Man Chor Layo Hai|| Taahikai Rahyo Gad(i) Kai Tih Te Nah(i) Chhodhtan Naik Bhayo Hai||
translation: Krishna causing his eyes to dance like deer, has stolen the minds of the gopis; their mind has been entrapped in the eyes of Krishna and does not move hither and thither for an instant;

gurmukhi: qwhI ky hyq iPrY bn mY qij kY giH sÍws n eyk lXo hY ]so ibrQw hm so bn BRwq kho hir jI ikh Er gXo hY ]
transliteration: Taahike Het Phirai Ban Mai Taj(i) Kai Grih Svaas Na Ek Layo Hai|| So Birthaadham So Ban Bhraat Kaho Har(i) Jikih Or Gado Hai||486||
translation: For him, withholding their breath, they are running hither and thither in the forest and saying, “O relatives of the forest ! tell us, on which side Krishna has gone?486.

gurmukhi: ijnhUM bn bIc mrIc mrXo pur rwvn syvk jwih dhXo h ]qwhI so hyq krXo hmhUM bhu logn ko auphws shXo hY ]
transliteration: Jinhoon Ban Beech Marich Daryo Pur Raavan Sewak Jaah(i) Dahyo Hai|| Taahiso Het Daryo Hamboon Bahu Logad Ko Oup-haas Sahyo Hai||
translation: He, who killed Marich in the forest and destroyed other servants of Ravana; he is the one whom we have loved and have endured the satirical sayings of many people;

gurmukhi: vw srsy diRg suMdr so imil gÍwrnIXwN ieh Bwiq khXo hY ]qwhI kI cot ctwk lgy hmro mnUMAw miRg Taur rhXo hY ]487]
transliteration: Vaa Sarse Drig Soundar So Mil(i) Gvaaraneeyaan Eh Bhaat(i) Kahyo Hai|| Tahikichot Chataak Lage Hamro Manoonaa Mrig Thaur Rahyo Hai||487||
translation: Regarding his delicious eyes all the gopis are saying thus with one voice; “Because of the hurt of those eyes, the deer of our mind has become motionless at one place.”487.
